meanings.definition: To give new life or energy to
meanings.sent1: She is revitalizing the garden by planting colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The company is revitalizing its marketing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The tired old car felt revitalizing after a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent4: His inspiring speech was like revitalizing sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The music had a revitalizing effect on everyone, lifting their spirits.

meanings.definition: To make something stronger or more active
meanings.sent1: Exercise is revitalizing my muscles and making me feel stronger.
meanings.sent2: The new software update is revitalizing the performance of the computer.
meanings.sent3: The energetic dance routine was revitalizing for the sleepy audience.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a revitalizing force that pushed her through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air and exercise were revitalizing, making him more alert and focused.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to restore strength or energy
meanings.sent1: The revitalizing drink gave her a burst of energy before the race.
meanings.sent2: The revitalizing massage left him feeling refreshed and invigorated.
meanings.sent3: The revitalizing power nap was just what she needed to continue working.
meanings.sent4: The revitalizing scent of the flowers filled the room with a sense of renewal.
meanings.sent5: The revitalizing effects of the vacation helped him recharge and relax.
